channel.title: Research on Pratheepa Jeganathan
channel.description: Recent content in Research on Pratheepa Jeganathan

item.title: Statistical Methods for Multi-domain Data
item.description: Data structure (container) for multi-domain genome-level data Statistical method for multi-domain genome-level data High-throughput technologies (Next-generation DNA sequencing, single-cell RNA sequencing, Mass spectrometry, etc.) have revolutionized the quantification of biomarkers at the genome-level. The high-throughput genomic data are complex because of high-dimensionality, heterogeneity, multi-domain, and sparsity. Data structure (container) for multi-domain genome-level data First, I am working on establishing a data structure for multi-domain genome-level data in R/Bioconductor.

item.title: Statistical Methods for Microbiome Data
item.description: Block Bootstrap Method Method Software Paper My Presentations A Bayesian Approach to Contamination Removal in Molecular Microbial Studies Software Paper(s) My Presentations References Block Bootstrap Method Rapidly evolving high-throughput sequencing technology enables the comprehensive search for microbial biomarkers using longitudinal experiments. Such experiments consist of repeated biological observations from each subject over time and are essential in accounting for the high between-subject and within-subject variability.

item.title: Microbiome Studies
item.description: Topic modeling for indentifying variation in microbial communities in plants and soil environment My Presentations Statistical Challenges in Microbiome Genome-level Data Topic modeling for indentifying variation in microbial communities in plants and soil environment Next-Generation Sequencing (NGS)-based technology now enables the high-throughput quantification of non-culturable microbial organisms in all environments. The use of microbial sequences has enhanced our understanding of the microbiome interactions at the interface of host-plant and soil environment and their roles in microbial ecology.

item.title: Approximation theory in statistics

Method Software Paper Saddlepoint-Based Bootstrap Method (SPBB) Method Software Paper Multivariate Saddlepoint-Based Bootstrap Method (mSPBB) In my first project for my Ph.
